input_text:
Job Title: Warehouse Supervisor - Night Shift

Location: Tampa, FL

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Description

Central Pet Distribution is hiring a Warehouse Supervisor - Night Shift

Do you love pets and love working as a leader in a fast-paced environment? Our growing company is seeking a Night Warehouse Supervisor to support out Pet Distribution business at our Tampa, FL location. The Pet Distribution team works together to supply our customers with the nation's top brands of pet supplies like Nylabone, Kaytee and Aqueon. In this role, you will be supervising warehouse activities including order selecting and shipping. If you have experience leading others, are committed to safety, and can create and support a culture of continuous improvement, this may be the job for you!

MEASURES OF SUCCESS

Completion of all shift duties and responsibilitiesTraining and development of all shift personnel, including training of new associatesOversee all picking and shipping activities, ensuring that orders are picked, packed, and loaded in a safe, accurate, timely and damage-free mannerAdjusting work procedures to meet warehouse demands as dictated by managerConfer with manager to coordinateactivities of individual departmentsEnforce company policies and safety regulations / conduct monthly safety meetingsUtilize company operating systems, Prelude, Vocollect, Dayforce and Insight ViaCoaching and motivating of associatesDelegate responsibilities of employees on PTOFill in for warehouse manager when needed

What We Are Looking For In a Candidate

High School graduate, with an Associates degree, preferred2-5 years of distribution warehouse experience with working knowledge of all warehouse activitiesMinimum 2 years of supervisor experience in a distribution warehouse environmentCertifications in powered industrial equipment. Forklifts, reach trucks, order picker, and rider pallet jack unitsWorking knowledge of RF replenishment proceduresAbility to work in and lead a team environmentWorking knowledge of Microsoft Office and Excel programsExperience in WMS (Warehouse Management Systems) such as VoCollect, Prelude and Dayforce a huge plus

Benefits Package & Employee Programs

Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision InsuranceFree Life and Disability InsuranceHealth and Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts401k with 3% company match and annual profit-sharing bonus!Paid vacation, holidays and sick timeEmployee Assistance ProgramDiscount on Pet supplies, cell phones, movie tickets, gym memberships, and more!Education AssistanceReferral Program with cash bonus

At Central Garden & Pet (NASDAQ: CENT and CENTA), we believe home is at the center of our lives, and our employees are driven by our purpose to nurture happy and healthy homes. Our company is made up of thousands of people across North America, with an emerging footprint across the U.K., Mexico, China and Canada - all dedicated to helping gardens bloom bigger, pets live healthier and communities grow stronger. We are united by our mission to lead the future of the garden and pet industriesone blade of grass and one wagging tail at a time. Visit our website at www.central.com to learn more.

We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
